channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How the Trump administration is reshaping the military
item.description: President Trump is deploying National Guard troops to U.S. cities, erasing "woke" in the military and striking alleged drug boats off Venezuela. The A...

item.title: The 10th and final escapee from a New Orleans jailbreak is captured after five months
item.description: Ten men escaped the Orleans Parish Justice Center through a hole in the wall behind a toilet on May 16. Most were captured within days, but Derrick Gr...

item.title: What to know about the Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: Anticipation is growing and bookies around the world are taking bets on who'll be awarded this year's Nobel Peace Prize. Here is what to know ahead of...

item.title: Why being in credit card debt doesn't mean you're bad with money
item.description: Financial educators bust three common myths about credit card debt — and explain why these negative assumptions can hold us back from making smart mon...

item.title: China curbs rare earth exports, raising stakes before Trump-Xi talks
item.description: Analysts say Thursday's announcement is China's bid to strengthen its leverage in trade talks with the U.S., ahead of a planned leaders' meeting.

item.title: 'Joy and pain': Palestinians celebrate deal but fear confronting grief
item.description: People in Gaza celebrate a potential end to the war, but know it will mean facing the grief they have put aside.

item.title: AP reader question: How might the federal shutdown affect the economy?
item.description: Here’s a question submitted by an Associated Press reader: How might the government shutdown affect the U.S. economy?

item.title: Trump says Israeli hostages should be released "Monday or Tuesday"
item.description: Trump says Hamas will likely release all Israeli hostages by early next week, as the "first phase" of a deal to end the war in Gaza is expected to tak...

item.title: Police fire rubber bullets as Madagascar protesters reject president's promises
item.description: President Andry Rajoelina had promised to resign if he didn't fix the country's problems within a year.

item.title: Illinois urges judge to stop National Guard deployment after Trump administration ‘plowed ahead’
Pope meets with Chicago union leaders, urges migrant welcome as crackdown underway in hometown
Arturo Gatti Jr., son of late boxing champion, dies at age 17
item.description: Gatti Jr. was 10 months old when his father, who was a world champion in two weight classes, died at age 37 in July 2009.

item.title: NBA games back in China for first time since Hong Kong row
item.description: Two games in Macau this weekend will be the first since the league was effectively frozen out in 2019.

item.title: Judge ruling on National Guard lawsuit filed by Illinois, Chicago today
item.description: A judge is set to rule on a lawsuit filed by Illinois and Chicago seeking to prevent the National Guard from being deployed by the federal government ...

item.title: Dominion Voting Systems acquired by St. Louis-based Liberty Vote
item.description: The acquisition brings together two major players providing key infrastructure for voting and voter verification systems across dozens of states ahead...

item.title: Naked mole rats' DNA could hold key to long life
item.description: The bald, subterranean rats are the world's longest-lived rodent.

item.title: South African farm worker describes how women fed to pigs to 'dispose of evidence'
item.description: Adrian De Wet tells the South African court that "when pigs are hungry enough, they'll eat anything".

item.title: Endangered ferrets in more jeopardy as government shutdown drags on
item.description: With biologists from the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service furloughed because of the shutdown, a critical release of 400 captive-bred ferrets is at risk.
